member.name: M:DaggerfallConnect.Utility.FileProxy.ReadCString(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a UTF8 string of length bytes from the binary reader.
member.param: Number of bytes to read (length=0 for null-terminated).
member.returns: String composed from bytes read (all NULLs are discarded).

member.name: M:DaggerfallConnect.Utility.FileProxy.ReadCStringSkip(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a UTF8 string of ReadLength bytes from the binary reader, then sets reader position to start + SkipLength. This handles a special case where a character buffer may be null-terminated, but still be of a fixed length. The remaining chars after the null may be filled with garbage. This method will read the specified number of characters, then skip to Reader.BaseStream.Position + SkipLength. When ReadLength=0, the string will be truncated at SkipLength if no null is found.
member.param: Number of bytes to read (length=0 for null-terminated).
Number of bytes to skip from start position after read.
member.returns: String composed from bytes read (all NULLs are discarded).

member.name: T:DaggerfallConnect.ImageFileReader
member.summary: A class for enumerating and reading all Daggerfall image files in a uniform manner. Provides caching and hashing to store and retrieve file data after being loaded. Known unsupported/invalid files will be filtered out automatically. Handles loading correct palette for each file. Manual enumerators (GetFirstFile, GetNextFile, etc.) are separate to IEnumerator. Usage can be mixed without any problems.

member.name: P:DaggerfallConnect.Arena2.MapsFile.AutoDiscard
member.summary: If true then decomposed regions will be destroyed every time a different region is fetched. If false then decomposed regions will be maintained until DiscardRegion() or DiscardAllRegions() is called. Turning off auto-discard will speed up region retrieval times at the expense of RAM. For best results, disable auto-discard and impose your own caching scheme using LoadRecord() and DiscardRecord() based on your application needs.

member.name: T:Vector3
member.summary: vector of doubles with three components (x,y,z)
member.author: Richard Potter BSc(Hons)
member.Changes: Magnitude is now a property Abs(...) now returns magnitude, Recommend: use magnitude property instead Equality opeartions now have a tolerance (note that greater and less than type operations do not) IsUnit methods also have a tolerence Generic IEquatable and IComparable interfaces implemented IFormattable interface (ToString(format, format provider) implemented Mixed product function implemented

member.name: F:Vector3.THREE_COMPONENTS
member.summary: Exception message descriptive text Used for a failure for an array argument to have three components when three are needed

member.name: F:Vector3.NORMALIZE_0
member.summary: Exception message descriptive text Used for a divide by zero event caused by the normalization of a vector with magnitude 0

member.name: F:Vector3.INTERPOLATION_RANGE
member.summary: Exception message descriptive text Used when interpolation is attempted with a control parameter not between 0 and 1

member.name: F:Vector3.NON_VECTOR_COMPARISON
member.summary: Exception message descriptive text Used when attempting to compare a Vector3 to an object which is not a type of Vector3

member.name: F:Vector3.ARGUMENT_TYPE
member.summary: Exception message additional information text Used when adding type information of the given argument into an error message

member.name: F:Vector3.ARGUMENT_VALUE
member.summary: Exception message additional information text Used when adding value information of the given argument into an error message

member.name: F:Vector3.ARGUMENT_LENGTH
member.summary: Exception message additional information text Used when adding length (number of components in an array) information of the given argument into an error message

member.name: F:Vector3.NEGATIVE_MAGNITUDE
member.summary: Exception message descriptive text Used when attempting to set a Vectors magnitude to a negative value

member.name: F:Vector3.ORAGIN_VECTOR_MAGNITUDE
member.summary: Exception message descriptive text Used when attempting to set a Vectors magnitude where the Vector3 represents the origin

member.name: F:Vector3.EqualityTolerence
member.summary: The tolerence used when determining the equality of two vectors

member.name: F:Vector3.x
member.summary: The X component of the vector

member.name: F:Vector3.y
member.summary: The Y component of the vector

member.name: F:Vector3.z
member.summary: The Z component of the vector

member.name: M:Vector3.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructor for the Vector3 class accepting three doubles
member.param: The new x value for the Vector3
The new y value for the Vector3
The new z value for the Vector3
member.implementation: Uses the mutator properties for the Vector3 components to allow verification of input (if implemented) This results in the need for pre-initialisation initialisation of the Vector3 components to 0 Due to the necessity for struct's variables to be set in the constructor before moving control

member.name: M:Vector3.#ctor(System.Double[])
member.summary: Constructor for the Vector3 class from an array
member.param: Array representing the new values for the Vector3
member.implementation: Uses the VectorArray property to avoid validation code duplication

member.summary: Constructor for the Vector3 class from another Vector3 object
member.param: Vector3 representing the new values for the Vector3
member.implementation: Copies values from Vector3 v1 to this vector, does not hold a reference to object v1

member.name: T:DaggerfallConnect.DFMesh
member.summary: Stores decomposed mesh data. A mesh is made up of one or more submeshes (DFSubMesh). Each submesh has a unique texture. All faces sharing a texture have been grouped into the appropriate submesh. Each submesh contains one or more planes (DFPlane). A plane is a collection of points (DFPoint) in a fan radiating from point 0. Planes with 3 points can be written as triangles to your 3D engine, however planes with 4 or more points must be written based on your needs. For example, if you wanted to write a triangle list then write the first triangle from the first three points (indices 0, 1, 2), then increment the second two point indices (0, 2, 3, then 0, 3, 4, and so on) until all points have been read. This structure has been chosen as a half-way point between native Daggerfall formats and modern 3D engines. How the data is used will depend on the engine chosen for visualisation.

member.name: T:DaggerfallConnect.Arena2.TextureFile
member.summary: Connects to a TEXTURE.??? file to enumerate and extract image data. Each texture file may contain one or more images, including animated records with multiple frames. Textures will only be converted from the source binary file when needed. This allows you to extract individual records and frames without the overhead of converting unwanted images. Combine this with a texture caching scheme when loading large 3D scenes to avoid unnecessary load time.

member.name: P:DaggerfallConnect.Arena2.Arch3dFile.AutoDiscard
member.summary: If true then decomposed mesh records will be destroyed every time a different record is fetched. If false then decomposed mesh records will be maintained until discardRecord() or discardAllRecords() is called. Turning off auto-discard will speed up mesh retrieval times at the expense of RAM. For best results, disable auto-discard and impose your own caching scheme using LoadRecord() and DiscardRecord() based on your application's needs.
